midas/examples/hbookexpt/frontend.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003   Name:         frontend.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Contents:     Experiment specific readout code (user part) of
00007                 Midas frontend. This example simulates a "trigger
00008                 event" and a "scaler event" which are filled with
00009                 CAMAC or random data. The trigger event is filled 
00010                 with two banks (ADC0 and TDC0), the scaler event 
00011                 with one bank (SCLR).
00012

00016   (Next, I'll commit our local customizations.)

00080 /*-- Globals -------------------------------------------------------*/
00081 
00082 /* The frontend name (client name) as seen by other MIDAS clients   */
00083    char *frontend_name = "Sample Frontend";
00084 /* The frontend file name, don't change it */
00085    char *frontend_file_name = __FILE__;
00086 
00087 /* frontend_loop is called periodically if this variable is TRUE    */
00088    BOOL frontend_call_loop = FALSE;
00089 
00090 /* a frontend status page is displayed with this frequency in ms */
00091    INT display_period = 3000;
00092 
00093 /* maximum event size produced by this frontend */
00094    INT max_event_size = 10000;
00095 
00096 /* maximum event size for fragmented events (EQ_FRAGMENTED) */
00097    INT max_event_size_frag = 5 * 1024 * 1024;
00098

00100    INT event_buffer_size = 10 * 10000;

00102 /* number of channels */

00104 #define N_TDC  4
00105 #define N_SCLR 4

00109 #define SLOT_IO   23
00110 #define SLOT_ADC   1
00111 #define SLOT_TDC   2
00112 #define SLOT_SCLR  3

00152    EQUIPMENT equipment[] = {
00153 
00154       {"Trigger",               /* equipment name */
00155        1, 0,                    /* event ID, trigger mask */
00156        "SYSTEM",                /* event buffer */
00157 #ifdef USE_INT
00158        EQ_INTERRUPT,            /* equipment type */
00159 #else
00160        EQ_POLLED,               /* equipment type */
00161 #endif
00162        LAM_SOURCE(0, 0xFFFFFF), /* event source crate 0, all stations */
00163        "MIDAS",                 /* format */
00164        TRUE,                    /* enabled */
00165        RO_RUNNING |             /* read only when running */
00166        RO_ODB,                  /* and update ODB */
00167        500,                     /* poll for 500ms */
00168        0,                       /* stop run after this event limit */
00169        0,                       /* number of sub events */
00170        0,                       /* don't log history */
00171        "", "", "",
00172        read_trigger_event,      /* readout routine */
00173        NULL, NULL,
00174        trigger_bank_list,       /* bank list */
00175        }
00176       ,
00177 
00178       {"Scaler",                /* equipment name */
00179        2, 0,                    /* event ID, trigger mask */
00180        "SYSTEM",                /* event buffer */
00181        EQ_PERIODIC | EQ_MANUAL_TRIG,    /* equipment type */
00182        0,                       /* event source */
00183        "MIDAS",                 /* format */
00184        TRUE,                    /* enabled */
00185        RO_RUNNING | RO_TRANSITIONS |    /* read when running and on transitions */
00186        RO_ODB,                  /* and update ODB */
00187        10000,                   /* read every 10 sec */
00188        0,                       /* stop run after this event limit */
00189        0,                       /* number of sub events */
00190        0,                       /* log history */
00191        "", "", "",
00192        read_scaler_event,       /* readout routine */
00193        NULL, NULL,
00194        scaler_bank_list,        /* bank list */
00195        }
00196       ,

00204 /********************************************************************\
00205               Callback routines for system transitions
00206 
00207   These routines are called whenever a system transition like start/
00208   stop of a run occurs. The routines are called on the following
00209   occations:
00210 
00211   frontend_init:  When the frontend program is started. This routine
00212                   should initialize the hardware.
00213   
00214   frontend_exit:  When the frontend program is shut down. Can be used
00215                   to releas any locked resources like memory, commu-
00216                   nications ports etc.
00217 
00218   begin_of_run:   When a new run is started. Clear scalers, open
00219                   rungates, etc.
00220 
00221   end_of_run:     Called on a request to stop a run. Can send 
00222                   end-of-run event and close run gates.
00223 
00224   pause_run:      When a run is paused. Should disable trigger events.
00225 
00226   resume_run:     When a run is resumed. Should enable trigger events.
00227 
00228                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           \********************************************************************//*-- Frontend Init -------------------------------------------------*/
00229     INT frontend_init()
00230 {
00231    /* hardware initialization */
00232 
00233    cam_init();
00234    cam_crate_clear(CRATE);
00235    cam_crate_zinit(CRATE);
00236 
00237    /* enable LAM in IO unit */
00238    camc(CRATE, SLOT_IO, 0, 26);
00239 
00240    /* enable LAM in crate controller */
00241    cam_lam_enable(CRATE, SLOT_IO);
00242 
00243    /* reset external LAM Flip-Flop */
00244    camo(CRATE, SLOT_IO, 1, 16, 0xFF);
00245    camo(CRATE, SLOT_IO, 1, 16, 0);
00246 
00247    /* print message and return FE_ERR_HW if frontend should not be started */
00248 
00249    return SUCCESS;
00250 }
00251 
00252 /*-- Frontend Exit -------------------------------------------------*/
00253 
00254 INT frontend_exit()
00255 {
00256    return SUCCESS;
00257 }

00292 {
00293    /* if frontend_call_loop is true, this routine gets called when
00294       the frontend is idle or once between every event */
00295    return SUCCESS;
00296 }

00300 /********************************************************************\
00301   
00302   Readout routines for different events
00303 
00304 \********************************************************************/
00305 
00306 /*-- Trigger event routines ----------------------------------------*/
00307 
00308 INT poll_event(INT source, INT count, BOOL test)
00309 /* Polling routine for events. Returns TRUE if event
00310    is available. If test equals TRUE, don't return. The test
00311    flag is used to time the polling */
00312 {
00313    int i;
00314    DWORD lam;
00315 
00316    for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
00317       cam_lam_read(LAM_SOURCE_CRATE(source), &lam);
00318 
00319       if (lam & LAM_SOURCE_STATION(source))
00320          if (!test)
00321             return lam;
00322    }
00323 
00324    return 0;
00325 }
00326 
00327 /*-- Interrupt configuration ---------------------------------------*/
00328 
00329 INT interrupt_configure(INT cmd, INT source, PTYPE adr)
00330 {
00331    switch (cmd) {
00332    case CMD_INTERRUPT_ENABLE:
00333       break;
00334    case CMD_INTERRUPT_DISABLE:
00335       break;
00336    case CMD_INTERRUPT_ATTACH:
00337       break;
00338    case CMD_INTERRUPT_DETACH:
00339       break;
00340    }
00341    return SUCCESS;
00342 }
00343 
00344 /*-- Event readout -------------------------------------------------*/
00345 
00346 INT read_trigger_event(char *pevent, INT off)
00347 {
00348    ADC0_BANK *adc0_bank;
00349    WORD *pdata, a;
00350    INT q, timeout;
00351 
00352    /* init bank structure */
00353    bk_init(pevent);
00354 
00355    /* create structured ADC0 bank */
00356    bk_create(pevent, "ADC0", TID_STRUCT, &adc0_bank);
00357 
00358    /* ADC0 variables can be accessed directly via adc0_bank->adc0 or
00359       as an array using pdata */
00360    pdata = (WORD *) adc0_bank;
00361 
00362    /* wait for ADC conversion */
00363    for (timeout = 100; timeout > 0; timeout--) {
00364       camc_q(CRATE, SLOT_ADC, 0, 8, &q);
00365       if (q)
00366          break;
00367    }
00368    if (timeout == 0)
00369       ss_printf(0, 10, "No ADC gate!");
00370 
00371    /* use following code to read out real CAMAC ADC */
00372    /*
00373       for (a=0 ; a<N_ADC ; a++)
00374       cami(CRATE, SLOT_ADC, a, 0, pdata++);
00375     */
00376 
00377    /* Use following code to "simulate" data */
00378    for (a = 0; a < N_ADC; a++)
00379       *pdata++ = rand() % 1024;
00380 
00381    /* clear ADC */
00382    camc(CRATE, SLOT_ADC, 0, 9);
00383 
00384    bk_close(pevent, pdata);
00385 
00386    /* create variable length TDC bank */
00387    bk_create(pevent, "TDC0", TID_WORD, &pdata);
00388 
00389    /* use following code to read out real CAMAC TDC */
00390    /*
00391       for (a=0 ; a<N_TDC ; a++)
00392       cami(CRATE, SLOT_TDC, a, 0, pdata++);
00393     */
00394 
00395    /* Use following code to "simulate" data */
00396    for (a = 0; a < N_TDC; a++)
00397       *pdata++ = rand() % 1024;
00398 
00399    /* clear TDC */
00400    camc(CRATE, SLOT_TDC, 0, 9);
00401 
00402    bk_close(pevent, pdata);
00403 
00404    /* clear IO unit LAM */
00405    camc(CRATE, SLOT_IO, 0, 10);
00406 
00407    /* clear LAM in crate controller */
00408    cam_lam_clear(CRATE, SLOT_IO);
00409 
00410    /* reset external LAM Flip-Flop */
00411    camo(CRATE, SLOT_IO, 1, 16, 0xFF);
00412    camo(CRATE, SLOT_IO, 1, 16, 0);
00413 
00414    ss_sleep(10);
00415 
00416    return bk_size(pevent);
00417 }
00418 
00419 /*-- Scaler event --------------------------------------------------*/
00420 
00421 INT read_scaler_event(char *pevent, INT off)
00422 {
00423    DWORD *pdata, a;
00424 
00425    /* init bank structure */
00426    bk_init(pevent);
00427 
00428    /* create SCLR bank */
00429    bk_create(pevent, "SCLR", TID_DWORD, &pdata);
00430 
00431    /* read scaler bank */
00432    for (a = 0; a < N_SCLR; a++)
00433       cam24i(CRATE, SLOT_SCLR, a, 0, pdata++);
00434 
00435    bk_close(pevent, pdata);
00436 
00437    return bk_size(pevent);
00438 }
